entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 9.17.25
entry.summary: House District 2 State Representative Virgle Osborne talks about a delay in the Special Session of the Legislature, and covers his decision to run for re-election.

entry.title: Umpqua Brewfest returns to Roseburg for 14th year
entry.summary: For over a decade, Umpqua Watersheds has hosted the Umpqua Brewfest, bringing in major breweries and home brewers from near and far to share the joys of craft beer and community gathering.

entry.title: Pinky Bratton isn't stopping yet
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — Melva "Pinky" Bratton said she never planned to help out at a preschool, but she's having fun as assistant teacher at Neighborhood Christian Preschool.

entry.summary: September 17, 2025 4:00 a.m. Roseburg saw a new record high temperature for the date on Tuesday. entry.title: Birds of a feather vanish together? Roseburg birders seek answers
entry.summary: A dire mystery has the Umpqua Valley Audubon Society asking the public for help: vast numbers of the migratory birds, Vaux’s Swifts, have disappeared. The hanging questions are: Why? And where have the swifts gone?

entry.title: Winston City Council discusses capital funding projects, ODOT construction and more in meeting

entry.title: New auto detailing service Shine District opens in Roseburg
entry.summary: With events such as the Graffiti Weekend and The Roseburg Swap Meet, Roseburg is a town synonymous with car culture. As such, auto enthusiasts often turn to car detailers to keep their rides looking fresh and clean.

entry.title: DFPA Confirms Six Prescribed Burns Scheduled This Week
entry.summary: DFPA has six prescribed burns scheduled this week: Sept. 16 in Oakland & Roseburg, Sept. 17 in Oakland & Roseburg, Sept. 18 on N. Umpqua Hwy in Roseburg, and Sept. 20 on Roberts Creek Rd in Roseburg. Burns aim to reduce wildfire risk under safe conditions.

entry.title: Bureau of Land Management plans trail maintenance day for Susan Creek Falls
entry.summary: Every Sept. 27, organizations across the country celebrate National Public Lands Day, a holiday dedicated to the conservation of public lands and the enrichment they bring to communities.

entry.title: Winston’s Now N Then Antique Mall Closing After 19 Years
entry.summary: Winston’s Now N Then Antique Mall may close Oct. 3 after 19 years unless an attorney can secure a lease extension. Specials include 50% off items marked 22 or 222. Vendors notified, showcases for sale, and a final parking lot sale may be held.

entry.title: 'Picasso at the Lapin Agile' continues at UACT
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — "Picasso at the Lapin Agile" continues through Sept. 24 at Umpqua Actors Community Theatre on West Harvard Avenue in Roseburg.

entry.title: Dancing in the street at the Umpqua Valley Farmer's Market
entry.summary: Corazón Oaxaqueño took over the center of the Umpqua Valley Farmers Market for more than an hour Saturday, performing three dances that each ran about 15 minutes and resembled short musicals. The routines included themes, plots and even a bullfight.
